mx.unam.fciencias.date

Class OrdinalDate

  • java.lang.Object
    • mx.unam.fciencias.date.OrdinalDate

  • public class OrdinalDate
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the sedrvices required to translate the ordinary date format dd/mm/yyyy to the ordinal one: yyyy-ddd. The days are numbered from 1 (january 1) to 366 (in leap years, usually 365).
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jos√© Galaviz

    • Method Detail

      • isLeapYear

        public static boolean isLeapYear(int year)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method determines if a given year is a leap year according to the rules of the Gregorian reform: Evey year which is multiple of 4 is a leap year unless it is also mutiple of 100, in whose case the year is leap if it is also multiple of 400.
        Parameters:
        year - is the numeric especification of the year. The parameter must be greater then 1582, in which the Gregorian reform was formulated.
        Returns:
        true if the given year is a leap year, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given year is below 1582.

      • leapYears

        public static int leapYears(int year)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the number of leap years between the given year and 1582.
        Parameters:
        year - the year whose previous leap years are requested.
        Returns:
        the number of leap years greater than 1582 and less than the given year.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given year is less than or equal to 1582.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main program. An example.

      • ordinalDay

        public static int ordinalDay(int year,
             int month,
             int day)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the number of day of the year that corresponds to the given date.
        Parameters:
        year - is the year of the date. It must be greater than 1582.
        month - is a number between 1 and 12 denoting the month of the year.
        day - is a number between 1 and the maximum number of days for the given month in the given year.
        Returns:
        the number of days previous and including the given date.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given date is invalid.

      • timeFrac

        public static float timeFrac(int hour,
             int mins)

      • weekDay

        public static java.lang.String weekDay(int year,
                       int month,
                       int day)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the name of the day of the week that corresponds to the given date.
        Parameters:
        year - is the number of the year (greater than 1582).
        month - is the number of the required month
        day - is the number of the day required
        Returns:
        a String with the name of the day of the week that corresponds to the given date
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentExeption - if the year is less than or equal to 1582.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • weekDayJan1

        public static java.lang.String weekDayJan1(int year)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the name of the day of the week that corresponds to the January 1 of the given year.
        Parameters:
        year - is the number of the year (greater than 1582).
        Returns:
        a String with the name of the day of the week that corresponds to January 1 of the year given as paramater.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentExeption - if the year is less than or equal to 1582.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • weekDayMon1

        public static java.lang.String weekDayMon1(int year,
                           int month)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the name of the day of the week that corresponds to the 1st day of the given month of the given year.
        Parameters:
        year - is the number of the year (greater than 1582).
        month - is the number of the required month
        Returns:
        a String with the name of the day of the week that corresponds to 1st day of the given month of the year given as paramater.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentExeption - if the year is less than or equal to 1582.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
